intro: Coussarea loftonii subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. The subspecies occidentalis is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and flowering patterns compared to other subspecies of Coussarea.
